intro: Cyphostemma tisserantii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots that help it access water from underground sources. Cyphostemma tisserantii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
